forumNotes.author: alacran
forumNotes.content:
i don't think it is possible.

But you could download this free Acronis versions (I'm not totaly sure they support UEFI booting but it is very possible since this versions are newer than your very old 2013 version):

Only requirement is: there is at least one HD of respective brand.

For Western Digital HD: [https://shop.western...ts/apps/acronis](https://shop.westerndigital.com/en-us/products/apps/acronis "External link")

For Seagate HD: [https://www.seagate....ads/discwizard/](https://www.seagate.com/support/downloads/discwizard/ "External link")

**NOTE:** This installable versions do not have all options available, but are good to make/restore backups and you can make a bootable ISO from them too.

Also it is very possible there is a version in your own language, just change country/lang selection to check that.

I don't use this free versions since long time ago that's why I'm not sure their created ISOs are UEFI capables.

alacran

forumNotes.author: alacran
forumNotes.content:
Other option is download my portable SFX version of wimlib-clc, that you can run from other OS or a WinPE, even using the lowest compression (XPREES wich is 4K) the WIM file created is very much smaller than the images created using Acronis.

[wimlib-clc 7z SFX LZMA2 Compressed Portable 20200605](http://reboot.pro/files/file/610-wimlib-clc-7z-sfx-lzma2-compressed-portable/ "")

NOTE: If running from a 10 OS, (not from a 10 WinPE), it has to be run as admin.

alacran

forumNotes.author: steve6375
forumNotes.content:
well sometimes it is possible to UEFI boot to a Linux kernel provided it makes no BIOS calls.

If you have a grub4dos menu that works you can write a grub2 menu using grub2 commands to load the kernel and initrd.

For instance, Easy2Boot v2 includes agFM (grub2) which supports user grub2 menus ( .grubfm or .cfg).

So you can try adding a .grubfm file and the ISO and have a play!
